extendedIngredients.name: coconut
extendedIngredients.originalString: 8 ounces Lindt Coconut White Chocolate, chopped

extendedIngredients.name: dark chocolate
extendedIngredients.originalString: 4 ounces chocolate ( dark, semisweet, bittersweet), chopped ( I used Lindt 70%)

extendedIngredients.aisle: Canned and Jarred;Milk, Eggs, Other Dairy
extendedIngredients.name: full fat coconut milk
extendedIngredients.originalString: ½ c full fat canned coconut milk

extendedIngredients.name: hot chocolate mix
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 Tbsp hot chocolate mix (I used Silly Cow Farms Chocolate Truffle)
metaInformation: (I used Silly Cow Farms Chocolate Truffle)

extendedIngredients.name: unsweetened coconut flakes
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 cup unsweetened finely shredded coconut flakes

recipes.title: Frozen Movie Themed Oscar Party with World Market #MovieLoversSweeps
recipes.instructions: In bowl set over a pan of barely simmering water, or a double boiler, combine the chocolates, coconut milk and salt and stir very slowly until the chocolate is melted and the mixture is thoroughly combined. Once fully combined remove from the heat and stir in the butter until its fully mixed in. Transfer to a bowl and chill until firm, either in the refrigerator for several hours or the freezer.Prepare a baking sheet with wax paper. Fill a bowl with a cup of the shredded coconut Scoop out scant tablespoon sized balls of the chocolate mixture and roll into a ball in your hands. Roll the balls one at a time in the shredded coconut and place on the prepared cookie sheet. Repeat until all the chocolate mixture is in balls and freeze until firmIn a small saucepan combine the chocolate, hot chocolate mix, cocoa powder and ¾ c of the milk. Whisk over medium heat until the chocolate is melted and everything is well combined. Let cool completely. Once cool combine the chocolate mixture with the remaining cup of milk to a blender with 2 cups of ice. Blend well and add more ice if desired. Divide amongst cups. Combine the heavy cream and powdered sugar and whip with a hand mixer until stiff peaks. Top the drinks with the whipped cream and sprinkle chocolate shavings on top. Serve immediately

steps.step: In bowl set over a pan of barely simmering water, or a double boiler, combine the chocolates, coconut milk and salt and stir very slowly until the chocolate is melted and the mixture is thoroughly combined. Once fully combined remove from the heat and stir in the butter until its fully mixed in.

Transfer to a bowl and chill until firm, either in the refrigerator for several hours or the freezer.Prepare a baking sheet with wax paper. Fill a bowl with a cup of the shredded coconut Scoop out scant tablespoon sized balls of the chocolate mixture and roll into a ball in your hands.
Roll the balls one at a time in the shredded coconut and place on the prepared cookie sheet. Repeat until all the chocolate mixture is in balls and freeze until firm
In a small saucepan combine the chocolate, hot chocolate mix, cocoa powder and ¾ c of the milk.
Whisk over medium heat until the chocolate is melted and everything is well combined.
Let cool completely. Once cool combine the chocolate mixture with the remaining cup of milk to a blender with 2 cups of ice. Blend well and add more ice if desired. Divide amongst cups.
Combine the heavy cream and powdered sugar and whip with a hand mixer until stiff peaks. Top the drinks with the whipped cream and sprinkle chocolate shavings on top.
